intro: Alsine jacquinii, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Alsine jacquinii is often found in disturbed areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
